tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.cacheCl: How frequently TES should clear out its tracking cache. Generally this should stay at default, but if you are noticing issues you can try adjusting it
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.damageP: What colour the damage-type particles should be. Format is ARGB
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.default: How long (in ticks) TES particles should display for
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.entityT: How close (in blocks) entities should be before TES starts tracking them
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.healPar: What colour the healing-type particles should be. Format is ARGB
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.hudArmo: Whether the TES HUD should render the entity's armour and toughness
What style TES font should render in for entity armour values in the HUD
NORMAL - Only the text with no additional stylings
DROP_SHADOW - Text with a bottom-right offset shadow
GLOWING - Text with a large high-contrast outline to emphasize the text.
OUTLINED - Text with a thin dark outline to emphasize the text. Selected by default.
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.hudBarF: Set how opaque the background behind the text on TES bars, if a render type is set that renders text
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.hudBoss: Whether the TES HUD should render for boss-type enemies (they usually have their own boss bar)
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.hudEnab: Whether the TES HUD should be enabled or not
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.hudEnti: Set whether the TES HUD's entity icon should keep the red 'tint' entities get when the real entity takes damage or not
Whether the TES HUD should render the entity's alignment icons
Whether the TES HUD should render the entity's name
Whether the TES HUD should render the entity's mod ID under its name
What style TES font should render in for entity names in the HUD
NORMAL - Only the text with no additional stylings
DROP_SHADOW - Text with a bottom-right offset shadow
GLOWING - Text with a large high-contrast outline to emphasize the text.
OUTLINED - Text with a thin dark outline to emphasize the text. Selected by default.
Whether the TES HUD should render the entity's image
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.hudPrev: Whether the TES HUD should cull any overflow for entities that don't scale properly to their rendering frame
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.hudHeal: Set how long the TES HUD health bar should be
Set whether the TES HUD health bar should render bar-segments
What style TES font should render in for entity health in the HUD (if applicable)
NORMAL - Only the text with no additional stylings
DROP_SHADOW - Text with a bottom-right offset shadow
GLOWING - Text with a large high-contrast outline to emphasize the text.
OUTLINED - Text with a thin dark outline to emphasize the text. Selected by default.
Select the health render type for the TES HUD
Numeric - Use numeric values for health only
Bar - Use a health-bar style render
Hybrid - Use a health-bar style render with numeric values overlaid
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.hudLeft: Manually adjust the left-offset rendering position of the TES HUD
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.hudOpac: Set how opaque the TES HUD should be, overall. The lower the value, the more transparent the HUD will be
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.hudPoti: Whether the TES HUD should render the entity's effect icons
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.hudHors: Whether the TES HUD should render horses' stats
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.hudRend: What position the TES HUD should render in
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.hudTarg: How close (in blocks) the player has to be to render a HUD for an entity under the crosshairs
Larger values may cost more performance
How long (in ticks) after looking away from an entity before its HUD should stop rendering
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.hudTopO: Manually adjust the top-offset rendering position of the TES HUD
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.inWorld: Set how long the TES in-world entity status bars should be
Select the bar render type for the in-game TES entity status HUD
Options:
Numeric - Use numeric values only
Bar - Use a health-bar style render
Hybrid - Use a health-bar style render with numeric values overlaid
Whether the in-world entity status bars should be segmented
When the TES in-world status bars should render
Not Targeting - Only when the entity isn't the one being rendered for the on-screen HUD
Not Targeting & Hurt - Only if not the currently targeted entity, if it has less than full health
Not Targeting Nearby & Hurt - Only if not the currently targeted entity, it is nearby and has less than full health
Options:
Always - Any entity currently visible
Nearby Only - Only entities nearby
Hurt Only - Only entities that have less than full health
Hurt & Nearby - Only entities that are nearby and have less than full health
While Targeting - Only the currently targeted entity
Targeting & Hurt - Only the currently targeted entity, if it has less than full health
Targeting Nearby & Hurt - Only the currently targeted entity if it is nearby and has less than full health
Whether the in-world entity status HUD should render the entity's armour values
What style TES font should render in for entity armour values in the in-world HUD
Options:
NORMAL - Only the text with no additional stylings
DROP_SHADOW - Text with a bottom-right offset shadow
GLOWING - Text with a large high-contrast outline to emphasize the text.
OUTLINED - Text with a thin dark outline to emphasize the text. Selected by default.
Whether TES should do in-world entity status bars
Whether the in-world entity status HUD should render the entity's alignment icons
Whether the in-world entity status HUD should render the entity's name
Whether the in-world entity status HUD should render the entity's mod ID under its name
Whether the in-world entity status HUD should render if the entity is a boss (they usually have their own boss bars)
What style TES font should render in for entity names in the in-world HUD
Options:
NORMAL - Only the text with no additional stylings
DROP_SHADOW - Text with a bottom-right offset shadow
GLOWING - Text with a large high-contrast outline to emphasize the text.
OUTLINED - Text with a thin dark outline to emphasize the text. Selected by default.
Whether the TES In-World HUD should be enabled for the player or not
What style TES font should render in for entity health in the in-world HUD (if applicable)
Options:
NORMAL - Only the text with no additional stylings
DROP_SHADOW - Text with a bottom-right offset shadow
GLOWING - Text with a large high-contrast outline to emphasize the text.
OUTLINED - Text with a thin dark outline to emphasize the text. Selected by default.
Set a manual vertical offset for the TES in-world HUD (in blocks) in the event of other mods doing overhead rendering
Whether the in-world TES entity status HUD should override vanilla name rendering
Whether the in-world entity status HUD should render the entity's effects icons
Whether the in-world TES entity status HUD should include horse stats
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.particl: How many decimals the numeric TES Particles should round to
Or set to 0 to only use whole-numbers
What style TES particles' font should render in
NORMAL - Only the text with no additional stylings
DROP_SHADOW - Text with a bottom-right offset shadow
GLOWING - Text with a large high-contrast outline to emphasize the text.
OUTLINED - Text with a thin dark outline to emphasize the text. Selected by default.
Scale modifier for TES-Particles. The higher the value, the larger the particles
Whether TES should do particles for various status changes such as damage dealt or health healed
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.teamBas: Whether TES should change the colour of damage particles to the colour of the team that dealt the damage (if applicable)
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.title: TES Config
tslatentitystatus.midnightconfig.verbalH: Whether TES should do verbal health-status particles (E.G. INSTAKILL) in certain situations
